intro: Odontanthera, commonly known as the toothed grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, tooth-like projections on the leaf blades, which give it its common name. These plants are typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, where they have adapted to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Odontanthera species are often used in restoration projects due to their resilience and ability to stabilize soil. Their flowering structures are usually small and inconspicuous, with spikelets that bear both male and female reproductive organs.
